Designated Training Providers are organizations or institutions that have successfully completed SkilledTradesBC's Designation Review Process. 

Application for Designation and the Designation Review Process provide a quality assurance mechanism to ensure that training providers meet SkilledTradesBC's program standards for training facilities, instructor qualifications, course curriculum, assessment processes, trade competencies and general operations. 

SkilledTradesBC designation is trade, level, and location-specific. 

Applying for Training Provider Designation 

**STEP 1**

Familiarize yourself with the program and review program information [for your trade](/find-your-trade)

Review the [Guidelines for Training Providers Applying for Program Designation](/media/1155/download)

STEP 2

Complete and submit the [Designation Application Form ](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/sites/default/files/2025-09/1A%20Designation%20Application%20Form.pdf)

If you have questions, please contact [designation@skilledtradesbc.ca](mailto:designation@skilledtradesbc.ca)

Additional Information

  * Designation must be renewed after five years from the date of issue. 

  * SkilledTradesBC shares the outcomes from the Designation Review Process with the [Private Training Institution Branch (PTIB)](http://www.privatetraininginstitutions.gov.bc.ca/). Non-public training providers operating in B.C. may need to comply with all PTIB regulations in order to apply for SkilledTradesBC Designation. Please consult PTIB to see if this applies to your institution. 




Relevant Policies
